paper_abstract: We consider the Work Function Algorithm for the k-server problem (Chrobak and Larmore, 1991: Koutsoupias and Papadimitriou, 1995) [2,4]. We show that if the Work Function Algorithm is c-competitive, then it is also strictly (2c)-competitive. As a consequence of (Koutsoupias and Papadimitriou, 1995) [4] this also shows that the Work Function Algorithm is strictly (4k - 2)-competitive. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the additive constant of the k-server Work Function Algorithm
